text:
*Position: Research Scientist (fulltime), Skoltech, Moscow, Advanced Data Analytics in Science and Engineering group / LARSS laboratory*

*Minimum qualifications:*

•	MS degree in Computer Science
•	2 years of work in Machine Learning.
•	Experience with Python.
•	Good spoken and written English

*Preferred qualifications:*

•	PhD degree in Machine Learning or related technical field.
•	Experience with deep learning: pytorch or similar.
•	2+ Scopus/WoS publications

*About the job*

We are looking for a research scientist to develop next-generation technologies in the challenging field of Machine learning. The application areas include Deep Learning in general and Anomaly Detection; the list is growing every day. As a research scientist, you will work on diverse projects in professor Burnaev’s research group. We need the research scientist to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic about taking on new and challenging machine learning problems.

You will work in the team that regularly publishes at top machine learning venues, develops projects for major companies, and will have to publish papers independently. We also expect trips to our partners at the University of Hamburg during work on this position. 

*Prospective research directions*

We have many projects to offer, and they roughly belong but not limited to the following areas:

• Anomaly detection
• Deep learning on graph data
• Oil&Gas applications of Machine learning
• Uncertainty estimation
• Data shift estimation
• Similarity learning for sequential and image data
*Responsibilities*

•	Develop machine learning algorithms
•	Automate and run machine learning experiments
•	Provide consistent solutions for real world problems
•	Prepare papers for scientific conferences
•	Help with data acquisition and preprocessing

*Related publications*
1. Ivan Nazarov, Evgeny Burnaev. Bayesian Sparsification of Deep C-valued networks. Proceedings of ICML, 2020 
2. S. Ivanov, E. Burnaev. Anonymous walk embeddings. ICML, 2018.  M. Munkhoeva, E. Kapushev, E. Burnaev, I. Oseledets. Quadrature based features for kernel approximation. Proceedings of NIPS, Spotlight talk, 2018 
3. Fursov, I., Zaytsev, A., Kluchnikov, N., Kravchenko, A., & Burnaev, E. (2020). Differentiable Language Model Adversarial Attacks on Categorical Sequence Classifiers. arXiv preprint arXiv:2006.11078.
4. Fursov, I., Zaytsev, A., Kluchnikov, N., Kravchenko, A., & Burnaev, E. (2020). Gradient-based adversarial attacks on categorical sequence models via traversing an embedded world. arXiv preprint arXiv:2003.04173.
5. Snorovikhina, V., & Zaytsev, A. “Unsupervised anomaly detection for discrete sequence healthcare data.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2007.10098 (2020).
6. Fursov, I., Zaytsev, A., Khasyanov, R., Spindler, M., & Burnaev, E. (2019). Sequence embeddings help to identify fraudulent cases in healthcare insurance. arXiv preprint arXiv:1910.03072.
*Conditions*
•	150 000-250 000 RUB
•	Nice office, Skolkovo Innovation Center, Moscow (now we work remotely) (!!!<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wreSxwZW60c>)
•	Flexible work hours
•	Medical insurance
•	Access to GPU cluster

Contact: <mailto:e.burnaev@skoltech.ru|e.burnaev@skoltech.ru>
